text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen Christmas 
and New Year is coming soon and many of you are

going to be cooking hosting dinner parties for 
a lot of people which is fun but it could also

be stressful stress out no more because today 
I'm going to share with you the tricks that I've

learned from working with professional caterers 
and doing catering of my own so that you can cook

an impressive meal and still enjoy the party for 
my own dinner parties I like to use these planning

templates because they help me stay organized save 
me a lot of time and spare me a lot of mistakes so

I'll talk about how I use these and if you like 
them you're more than welcome to download them

from my website so you can try them out there 
are two things that are absolutely key when it

comes to cooking for a large group and that is 
one spreading out the workload and two planning

of the details which is actually quite easy to do 
using this template so say a party is on Saturday

I'm going to give you a five-day countdown plan 
of action starting from Tuesday and you see how

much easier everything seems when you plan ahead 
at a minimum of four days before your party you

want to plan out what you're going to cook and 
write it down many people underestimate the power

of writing down the menu on a piece of paper it 
actually gives you a chance to look at everything

with a bird's eye view and see if all the dishes 
balance each other well for example this here is

the first draft of mine menu so I thought about 
okay what do I want to cook here are some of the

things I think would be good and now I see that 
I have two stewey things on the menu I don't want

that so I'm gonna get rid of my muscleman curry 
and I'm going to do shrimp cakes instead and then

I real cat and then I realize now I no longer 
have any poultry on the menu which is you know

something you want to have but now I have two red 
meats so I going to get rid of mine um top beef

and then do pies famous fried chicken instead and 
now I'm looking okay it looks good have some seats

with some chicken some beef everything looks 
well-balanced I'm happy with the menu now once

you've got what you think is your final menu put 
it away don't look at it until tomorrow so now

that you've had a chance to sleep on your menu you 
want to look at it again the next day with a fresh

eye and see if it's still something that you think 
is a good idea because often times you'll catch

something now that you didn't before or you will 
have come up with a better idea between then and

now now once you've decided on a final menu we're 
going to write a shopping list now this is where

my template comes in really handy I first list 
out all the dishes across the top and then for

each dish I list all the ingredients even if it's 
a repeat from another dish write it any way if you

need to buy a specific amount of something don't 
forget to include that here as well if you're

working from a recipe you can just copy down the 
ingredient list off of the recipe but if you're

freestyling like I often do this step actually 
helps you think about and streamline what you're

going to do in your head and help you mentally 
prepare for it this may seem tedious but trust me

it eliminates a chance of you forgetting anything 
and then if you created this list on the computer

you can print it out and you're gonna take this 
and check your pantry and cross off anything that

you already have and cross off anything that's 
a repeat from another dish and now you have your

complete shopping list and you can just take 
this to the store you want to do your shopping

two days before your party not the day before and 
definitely not the day off because you want to

be able to focus on those days just on prepping 
and cooking and not running around town looking

for ingredients and it's also going to give you 
enough time to come up with a plan B in case it

turns out that something you need isn't available 
the only exception to that is highly perishable

things such as fresh seafood which you want to 
get the morning of the party if possible you

so the party is tomorrow you just spend today 
doing everything that can be done the day before

now this is where the second template that I have 
called the prep schedule comes in really really

handy but first let's talk about what kinds of 
things can be done the day before you can cut

and marinate your protein you can also cut most 
of your vegetables today if multiple vegetables

go in the same dish you can put them in the same 
container like a little kit and if they don't

go in at the same time you can separate them 
using parchment or saran wrap you can make all

your sauces and dressings and finally you can 
make an entire dish and be done with it a day

ahead of time such as braced and stewed dishes 
casseroles and they'll even taste better the

next day and here's how you can use the prep 
schedule to help you plan out your prep so on

the prep schedule you put all the dishes down on 
one side on the first column and on this column

day before you're gonna put down the tasks that 
can be done ahead of time for that dish and on

this column for day of you're going to put down 
whatever tasks are left to do once you've done

that you're going to fill in this little column 
labeled P which stands for priority this is where

you mark what needs to be done first or towards 
the end for example making a stew takes hours

so that's going to be your first priority so 
I'm gonna mark that with a1 this is also going

to take a while so I'm gonna do that second 
I mark that with a2 soaking the rice I want

to do that in the evening because I don't want 
it soaking for too long so I'm gonna mark that

with p.m. and then everything else that doesn't 
have a mark I'll do that anytime in between and

as you're doing your prep you just have this 
with you and cross things off as you're done

this right here is going to save you so much 
time and stress because you no longer have to

think about what you need to do next you're 
just tackling the list one thing at a time

and the party is today and since you've done such 
a good job with your advanced prep today you just

focus on the food quality presentation getting 
things out on schedule and being a wonderful

non stressed-out host you should have your 
priorities figured out for all your tasks

before you start executing and it's a little bit 
trickier today because things are time sensitive

so it helps me to think about things in two 
directions what needs to be done and what can

be done from the first minute going forward and 
then what needs to be done from the last minute

back up here's what I mean on our prep schedule 
let's first think going forward what needs to

be done and what can be done first for example 
I want to prep the fish first for steaming and

just leave it in the fridge so that I don't 
have to worry about it again until it's time

to cook and then cooking the mushrooms for the 
salad they don't need to be served hot so I can

do that second and get it out of the way after 
you get your first priorities out of the way

you want to flip your thinking around and start 
marking things that need to be done as close to

serving time as possible for example our fish 
needs to be served as soon as it's done and it

needs ten minutes to cook so I'm going to start 
cooking that 15 minutes to go time - 15 so I give

myself a little 5-minute margin for plating and 
other things that might come up I also have a

bunch of stuff labeled as D for delegate which 
brings me to an important point get somebody to

help you if at all possible don't try to do it 
all on your own and don't wait for somebody to

offer themselves either ask your friends or your 
family member if they want to be the official

sous chef of the night it is of tremendous 
value when you've got somebody around who

can help you with little things like can you 
please toss the salad can you put this on the

table can you answer my texts because my hands 
are dirty it frees you up so you can now focus

on the things that really need your attention 
and your skills and most of the time people love

being the sous chef they even feel special that 
you asked and that's it that's my dinner party

planning system now you're more than welcome to 
download these templates which I personally you

or you can just take the idea and create something 
that works for you but the takeaway message is

this investing a little time in planning and 
spreading out the workload throughout the week

will eliminate all that dinner-parties stresses 
you might have now I hope you found this helpful

if you enjoy the show please click to subscribe 
and I wish you a wonderful stress-free party
